Meaning: used at the end of a sentence to indicate consultation, suggestion, request or command
to help, to assist, to aid
used after a verb or an adjective to introduce a complement of result or degree
(used before a noun or pronoun) to, for
(used for clothes among other items) piece
used to indicate a conclusion or resolution
to travel, to take a trip
to get up, to get out of bed
to work, to do a job
to fall ill, to be sick
to speak, to say, to talk
to have or take a rest
to want to, would like to
used after a verb, indicating an act or an attempt
sport; to take physical exercise, to work out
